repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - The Coal Pilot Project and the
            Coal Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcomes of both projects was
            satisfactory and project sustainability for the Pilot
            Project is rated as highly likely, while project
            sustainability for the SECAL is more complex, though the
            sustainability of its benefits was rated as likely. The
            institutional development impact of the Pilot was rated as
            substantial, while that for the SECAL project was only
            modest. World Bank and Borrower performances in both
            projects were rated as satisfactory. Several lessons were
            learned: Quick-disbursing SECALs are inappropriate vehicles
            for supporting sector restructuring programs. SECALs in
            support of mine closures should be designed with several
            small, flexible tranches, rather than a small numberof large
            tranches. Projects designed to support setor restructuring
            should have a clear focus on poverty reduction objectives.
            The financial and economic performance of pilot projects
            activities needs to be carefully monitored. The Bank needs
            to make greater efforts to help improve the eficiency of
            mine closure activities. The Bank should consider working
            more closely with other bilateral and multicultural agencies
            that are providing seed money for establishing local
            cooperatives and other self-help institutions.

repnme.cdata!: Ukraine - Coal Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory, but project sustainability is assessed as
            unlikley on the basis that the policies as pursued under the
            original Sector Adjustment Loan (SECAL) design will probably
            also in the near future not be fully implemented. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances are rated as satisfactory.
            Lessons learned included the following: The creation of the
            Ukrainian State Company for Coal Sector Restructuring (UDKR)
            has been a key to the success of this project. There have
            been closures by mining companies but they were not finished
            and normally these mines ended up with UDKR to complete the
            task. The SECAL implementation also has shown that an agency
            like UDKR needs to be protected. There have been attempts by
            the coal industry and by local administrations to abolish or
            weaken UDKR. Furthermore, the agency should have its own
            fully secured budget. Another lesson is that an investment
            operation is preferred over an adjustment operation since
            restructuring depends critically on adequate financing.
            Also, realistic goal-setting is important. The selection of
            financial performance criteria for the restructuring of an
            old industrial sector should be avoided. Instead, simple
            physical criteria that can be achieved and easily monitored
            should be preferred.

5082985.majtheme: Economic management,Social protection and risk management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!: Ukraine - Coal Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Coal Sector Adjustment Loan (Coal
            SECAL) will provide a significant portion of Ukraine's
            balance of payments and budget deficit financing needs in
            late 1996 and in 1997, including part of the fiscal costs of
            restructuring the coal sector.  The Bank's provision of
            the loan, and its associated conditionality will enhance the
            credibilities of the Government's sector reform
            program.  The SECAL will be quick disbursing and will
            provide budget and balance of payments support, linked to
            the conditionality specified for tranche release.
            Disbursements of the loan will not be linked to any specific
            purchases, but will be subject to a standard negative list
            of ineligible goods and countries of origin.
